newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville Power cuts peak-hour offer to $17/MWh.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville Power cuts peak-hour offer to $17/MWh.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) lowered its price offer for surplus power during Wednesday's peak-demand hours to $17.00 a megawatt hour (MWh), down from $18.00 for Tuesday pre-schedulings, BPA said.
BPA also offered power at $13.00 and $14.50 during off-peak hours on Wednesday.
Northwest-only prices were listed at $7.00 and $9.00.
For Tuesday, Bonneville offered power between 1000 and 2000 PDT at $18.00, transmissions between 2200 and 2300 were offered at $16.00 and early-morning volumes were offered at $13.00.
Trade sources suggested the federal power marketing agency still had surplus hydroelectric power on hand and was jockeying to stay competitive with prices of alternative supplies.
